intro: Euphrasia alpina proles gautieri, commonly known as the Alpine eyebright, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem. Euphrasia alpina proles gautieri is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its potential health benefits.
